is not as densely inhabited as the West, and is thus more of an "off the beaten track" destination than the west.

East Greenlandic is the local language, and contains a number of variations from the West Greenlandic "official" language of Greenland. As with the rest of the country, Danish is commonly spoken and many people will have a functional command of English.

;By plane
There are two airports along the eastern cost,
. Both require helicopter transfer to the main settlements in their neighbourhood,
. Both airports have flights from the west coast by Air Greenland and in the summertime from Iceland by Air Iceland.
